title: much like helvetica ultra compressed but with vertical line in every character
content:
Any idea what the font is used on this 1984 George Orwell book cover?

Font: 

 compacta light 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162754/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [George-Orwell-1984.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162754/http:/typophile.com/files/George-Orwell-1984.jpg) | 93.91 KB |
author: abeloosdesign

comments.content: It must be **[Compacta (Light)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162754/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype&ffam=Compacta%20LT%20Std%20-%20Light&fid=86298f852cfb11b1002c14d9292d4215&fsize=60&text=1984%20GEORGE%20ORWELL&fit=1)** by Fred Lambert [1963] + the vertical line

Very creative cover. Love the domineering eye, barb ware and communist symbols as expressions of the theme of 1984. First time I have seen a stencil version of Compacta. Found a previous thread showing another use of the same idea [http://imap.typophile.com/node/66731](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162754/http:/imap.typophile.com/node/66731 "http://imap.typophile.com/node/66731")  
Don
Looks like a stencil version of [Compacta](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162754/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/compacta). Manually?

Thanks all 3.  
Compacta light it is. I was hoping a stencil version existed but I guess it was added manually.
